(سرائیکی) is spoken widely in central Pakistan, especially the provinces of southern
. Saraiki is an old language. You hear it mostly in the countryside, but people in
also mainly speak Saraiki. The language is usually considered a dialect of Punjabi or Sindhi.

value: kh: Think of how the Scottish say loch or a German ch.
gh: A guzzle type sound from deep in the throat that's hard for westerners. Have someone from North Africa, the Middle East, or Asia help you pronounce it.

How are you: kay haal hen? (Less formal) or tuhaaDey kiaa haal hin? = تہاݙے کیا حال ہِن۔ (Formal to be used with strangers and the elderly).

I'm fine: Main teek aan or Changey haal hin.= چنگے حال ہِن

Welcome! = bismillaah Sain!= بسم اللہ سائیں

I'm bad: Kharab 

Whats your name?: Tuada na kya hay?

My name is...: mera nam .... hey.

Thank you: Shukriya = شکریہ

Welcome!: Bismillaah Sain!= بسم اللہ سائیں

Goodbye!: khuda hafeez!

Yes: jee, or, haa.

No: nahi

Forwards: aggoon

Backwards: pichoon

Left: khabbay

Right: sajjay

Up : utoon

Down: talloon

Where is ...?: keeta hey....?

Bathroom:?: Ghusal khana

police:?: police

I need a doctor!: Docktor!!!

I've been hurt.: menoon chot lagi hai!!

Stop!: ruk

Water: panni

Soda: pepsi

Bread: naan (depends on what type of bread, chapati, naan, roti learn the differences)!

Chicken: murgha
Lamb/Goat : ghosht?

In Pakistan, the firefighters are called the "Fire Brigade".

Most people understand the word doctor and will come to your aid.

Pepsi is just a generall term for soda; if they actaully HAND you a pepsi, tell them the brand of soda you want.

Remember, Seraiki DOES have dialects, but no matter where you speak it, even if you're from
and you are talking to somebody from
, they will understand you; it's only a slight difference.
